data.title: Good eats, a bit of a drive from post, menu changes
data.text: This is one of the higher end places to eat in Killeen, but not by price.  It offers a higher class of food and the menu changes, so be prepared for that.  Delicious.  VERY small dining room, not good for large groups.

data.title: Excellent, fresh, tasty Korean-inspired lunch
data.text: This may be my new favorite restaurant in Killeen.  I decided to grab lunch downtown to go early voting, and found this recommendation on TripAdvisor.  This is a really nice, unique, locally owned café on a street corner in downtown Killeen.  Very nice waitress, waited 15 or so minutes after ordering, got really tasty gochujang-marinated chicken with white rice, cucumber kimchi and egg roll.  Price was not inexpensive, but the quality of the food was better than anything I have ever had in Killeen, particularly in the downtown area.  There are a number of inexpensive menu items as well.  I hope this place sticks around for a while.

data.title: Love Food...Visit Now!
data.text: If You Love Food, you must visit this place, there is no other place like it, food is great, chef is awesome and the place has a home feel to it...you would not even imagine a place like this in Killeen, maybe NY, LA...Miami... Nope...Killeen, go visit, you will NOT be disappointed...be careful, is addictive!

data.title: Awesome Lunch
data.text: Ate here for lunch- AMAZING ! Interesting menu and the food was delicious. Sprout salad yummy! Bogogi cheese melt was fabulous. You have to try this place!!

data.title: Brunch
data.text: Wanted to try this place for sometime. My husband and I decided to go for brunch and we were not disappointed. The food was just simply fantastic. We had the bulgogi egg tacos and wish I could keep eating them all day long! And we also got a scratch burger with an egg topping, now that's is what I call a brunch burger! There were so many things on the menu that sounded amazing I'm suprised we didn't try and order one of everyhing! Can't wait to come back and try all they have, because in one sitting they have made a returning customer for life!!

data.title: Food truck burger
data.text: We ate our food from the Scratch food truck that was at the Killeen food truck Friday park. The chef was friendly and the burgers were delicious!

data.title: Really Good Food
data.text: I stopped by this place on a whim because I was working on a job on the next block over.  Seating area was clean and nice looking. I ordered the bulgogi with kimchi and rice plus an egg roll. Everything tasted delicious.  The wait staff was courteous and drinks were refilled faster than I could drink them.  5-Stars food and staff!

data.title: Good food, Good atmosphere.
data.text: great variety of food choices for everyone with reasonable price. Fast and friendly service. Great bar drinks and on friday night they had a musician.

data.title: Came back 2 days in a row
data.text: Great food, love the Korean flavor! One of the group favorites is the breakfast omelet, had that 2 days in a row. For lunch or dinner be sure to have the mac and cheese egg rolls.

data.title: Good Gourmet food
data.text: The menu is limited to about 4-5 items (regular) then there is the chef special of the day (usually very gourmet) Pretty good. The atmosphere is great for a date or just friends out dining. Sometimes they have live music.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: Really good food and made from scratch!  Wait staff was warm and personable,bathrooms were clean and the pressed tin ceiling was beautiful!  Great stop!

data.title: Sunday Brunch!
data.text: I look forward to my peaceful Sunday mornings at the bistro for brunch and my mimosa. So happy to have a place like this in town that serves such high quality cuisine.

data.title: Changing the Killeen food scene
data.text:
I've been eating chef Arika's food since he was cooking out of a food truck. I am so happy that he has a restaurant that I can go to anytime. His food is thoughtfull and inspired, everything on the menu is delicious. There is nothing like it in Killeen and that makes it a true gem.

The only reason I didn't give Scratch a perfect score is because of the service. They keep trying to improve everyday on customer service and for that reason I will continue to go back.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: This place is small but the food is good! I was skeptical about some of the menu choices but this was like 3rd time here and I try something different each time and I've never been disappointed. The service can be slow at times, but they are super friendly so it's worth it!

data.title: Nice
data.text: Nice place to sit and eat in peace and quiet, the food is good and you get a bang for the buck there.

data.title: Fabulous food!
data.text: We have used this Bistro for catering several times and the food never disappoints.   Burgers, fries, tacos, veggie shooters, so many great items and all are made fresh....you can taste it!!

data.title: no return
data.text: we went to try something new. will not return. service was slow and no care as well as being overpriced.

data.title: Good Breakfast Option
data.text: Scratch Elevated Bistro was a good Sunday brunch option with fresh ingredients prepared well.  I had the breakfast chorizo and egg tacos, served with a side of the freshest, ripest, tastiest mixed fruit bowl. My friend had one of the omelets.   The food was all exceptional.  The wait staff while friendly, were not readily available. However,  I'd go back here for the affordable fresh choices -- in relative terms this place is a real find for Killeen.

data.title: Nice change for lunch
data.text:
My friend and I wanted to try a new place for lunch, and based on recommendations of other friends, we stopped in here. It is a small but quaint place in downtown Killeen. The service was great and the food even better. I had the Scratch burger with apple slaw. My friend ordered the fish tacos with grown up macaroni and cheese. Everything was fresh and delicious. 

I will definitely go back and try other menu items. Don't miss out!

data.title: Very Good Food!
data.text: This restaurant is relatively new, and it is located downtown in the renovated area.  It is small with a casual atmosphere, an industrial vibe that is a little cozy, and a bar.  I came for an early lunch during a weekday, and this visit was my first.  I ordered the fish tacos with the soup of the day as my side.  The fish tacos were wonderful--perfectly cooked seasoned fish with pineapple and cabbage on flour tortillas and a nicely seasoned sauce.  The soup of the day was a chicken squash soup that seemed simple, and, yet, it was very flavorful and satisfying.  It had chunks of chicken with grated zucchini squash.  It is a little pricey.   The service was good, but the restaurant wasn't crowded at that time.
